blackengine.rendering.pipeline

Class PipelineManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackengine.rendering.pipeline.PipelineManager

  • public class PipelineManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all renderers in an ordered fashion, and mapped by the class of the shader they use.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PipelineManager()
      Default constructor for creating a new instance of RendererMap.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PipelineManager

        public PipelineManager()
        Default constructor for creating a new instance of RendererMap. Creates a default comparator that uses the Float.compare method.

    • Method Detail

      • removeDestroyedPipelineElements

        public void removeDestroyedPipelineElements()
        Removes all destroyed elements of the pipeline.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Calls the destroy method on each of the renderers this instance contains, and clears the reference to them.

      • put

        public <S extends MaterialShaderProgram,M extends Material<S>> void put(Renderer<S,M> renderer)
        Puts a new renderer in the pipeline. If one using the same shader program class was already present, that one will be destroyed and replaced with the new one. The render targets that were present in the old renderer will be transferred to the new renderer.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        M -
        Parameters:
        renderer - The renderer to be added to this renderer map.

      • destroyRendererWith

        public void destroyRendererWith(java.lang.Class<? extends MaterialShaderProgram> shaderProgramClass)
        Destroys and removes the renderer using the specified shader class, if any.
        Parameters:
        shaderProgramClass - The class of the shader program used by the renderer that is to be removed.

      • destroyRendererFor

        public <S extends MaterialShaderProgram,M extends Material<S>> void destroyRendererFor(RenderComponent<S,M> renderComponent)
        Destroys and removes the renderer that can be used to render the specified component.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        M -
        Parameters:
        renderComponent - The render component that will be used to look up the compatible renderer.

      • getRendererWith

        public <S extends MaterialShaderProgram,M extends Material<S>> Renderer<S,M> getRendererWith(java.lang.Class<S> shaderProgramClass)
        Retrieves the renderer using the specified shader program class, if any.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        M -
        Parameters:
        shaderProgramClass - The class of the shader program that is used by the renderer.
        Returns:
        An instance of Renderer, or null if none was found.

      • getRendererFor

        public <S extends MaterialShaderProgram,M extends Material<S>> Renderer<S,M> getRendererFor(RenderComponent<S,M> renderComponent)
        Retrieves the renderer that is compatible with rendering the specified instance of render component, if any.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        M -
        Parameters:
        renderComponent - The render component for which a compatible renderer will be found, if any.
        Returns:
        A renderer that is compatible with the specified render component, or null if none was found.

      • containsRendererWith

        public boolean containsRendererWith(java.lang.Class<? extends MaterialShaderProgram> shaderProgramClass)
        Checks whether a renderer using the specified shader program class is present.
        Parameters:
        shaderProgramClass - The class of the shader program the renderer should be using.
        Returns:
        True if a renderer using the specified shader class is present, false otherwise.

      • containsRendererFor

        public <S extends MaterialShaderProgram,M extends Material<S>> boolean containsRendererFor(RenderComponent<S,M> renderComponent)
        Checks whether a renderer is present that is compatible with the specified render component.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        M -
        Parameters:
        renderComponent - The render component for which it will be checked if a compatible renderer is present.
        Returns:
        True if a renderer was found that is compatible with the render component, false otherwise.

      • put

        public <S extends ProcessingShaderProgram> void put(Processor<S> processor)
        Puts a new processor in the pipeline. If one using the same shader program class was already present, that one will be destroyed and replaced with the new one.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        Parameters:
        processor - The processor that will be added to the pipeline.

      • destroyProcessorWith

        public <S extends ProcessingShaderProgram> void destroyProcessorWith(java.lang.Class<S> shaderProgramClass)
        Destroys and removes the processor using the specified shader class, if any.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        Parameters:
        shaderProgramClass - The class of the shader program used by the processor that is to be removed.

      • getProcessor

        public <S extends ProcessingShaderProgram> Processor<S> getProcessor(java.lang.Class<S> shaderProgramClass)
        Retrieves the processor using the specified shader program class, if any.
        Type Parameters:
        S -
        Parameters:

        public boolean containsProcessorWith(java.lang.Class<? extends ProcessingShaderProgram> shaderProgramClass)
        Checks whether a processor using the specified shader program class is present.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
